channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023070049
item.description:
Report E-2023070049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the final inspection of the waste before loading it for outbound transportation to the disposal facility, a 55 gallon metal open top drum was found to have a pinhole leak in the sidewall that was not apparent on Friday during the facility inspection. The drum was promptly overpacked. Approximately ~100 ml of liquid was cleaned up from the pallet it leaked onto.

item.title: Report I-2023060172
item.description:
Report I-2023060172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: SAINT MARTINVILLE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 9:00 am leak was noticed at a customer location, hazmat one was called at 09:25 am. Hazmat One was getting a team enroute and making all necessary call to state and parrish police. Trailer had to be unloaded and it was found that since the totes were loaded valve to valve it caused one of the valve's in the nose of trailer to leak. Tote was transfered to a new tote, trailer was washed out and area around the trailer was cleaned up.

item.title: Report E-2023070126
item.description:
Report E-2023070126

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2023, at 0400 EST, XPO Logistics Terminal LSL experienced a UN3264 “Sure Klean 600” release from a 5-gallon poly jug due to a pallet puncture impacting the trailer floor and concrete lot below. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all on site cleanup operations. On June 30, 2023, at 0723 EST, contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately all 5-gallons of product released from the jug impacting an 8’ x 20’ area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. Three impacted pallets were cut up and containerized along with the empty jug and impacted absorbents. The waste was placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums and then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070074
item.description:
Report E-2023070074

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 15, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of hydrogen peroxide was punctured and released less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazMat Special Services (HMSS) to remediate the site. The 330-gallon tote of hydrogen peroxide had sustained damage to the top, but less than one (<1) gallon had released to the trailer. HMSS personnel utilized absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted trailer floor. HMSS personnel then transferred the product from the 330-gallon tote to another 330-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one (1) vented poly drum along with the used absorbent pads. This drum was staged on-site in the terminal's waste holding room for further evaluation.
